meanings.definition: A person or entity with whom one has a financial transaction.
meanings.sent1: I made a deal with my counterparty to buy some apples.
meanings.sent2: The bank serves as the counterparty in the loan agreement.
meanings.sent3: My counterparty in the stock trade was a squirrel who wanted acorns instead of money.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, your counterparty can be a dragon demanding gold instead of cash.
meanings.sent5: The counterparty in the business deal turned out to be a talking cat with a briefcase.

meanings.definition: The other party in a financial agreement or contract.
meanings.sent1: She signed the contract with her counterparty, agreeing to the terms.
meanings.sent2: The counterparty failed to fulfill their obligations in the deal.
meanings.sent3: At the negotiation table, my counterparty insisted on being paid in seashells.
meanings.sent4: The counterparty in the trade seemed like a shadowy figure, always one step ahead.
meanings.sent5: When the deal went sour, the counterparty vanished into thin air, leaving only a puff of smoke.
